Object Detection¶

Identifies and locates objects in an Image.

Usage: Tracking objects, Counting people, Vehicle Detection, etc.

client.object_detection(image_url=None, image_path=None, tensorflow=True,
azure=False, output_types=["json"]):
Parameters

  • image_url – Image URL

  • image_path – Local Image Path

  • tensorflow – if True, uses tensorflow for object detection

  • azure – if True, returns azure results of object detection on given image

  • output_types – Type of output requested by client: “json”, “image”

Return type

A json obj containing the output of object detection “””

Example:

import dltk_ai
client = dltk_ai.DltkAiClient('YOUR_API_KEY')

image_url = "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c2/2018_BMW_X3_xDrive30d_M_Sport_Automatic_3.0_Front.jpg/515px-2018_BMW_X3_xDrive30d_M_Sport_Automatic_3.0_Front.jpg"

object_detection_response = client.object_detection(image_url=image_url, azure=True)

print(object_detection_response)

Face Detection¶

Analyses an individual’s face in an image.

Usage: Automated identity verification.

Note

Presently supports Face Detection only.

client.face_analytics(image_url=None, features=None, image_path=None, dlib=False,
opencv=True,azure=False, mtcnn=False,output_types=["json"]):
Parameters

  • image_url – Image URL

  • features – Type of features requested by client. Presently supports “face_detection”.

  • image_path – Local Image Path

  • dlib – if True, uses dlib for face analytics

  • opencv – if True, uses opencv for face analytics

  • azure – if True, returns azure results of face analytics on given image

  • mtcnn – if True, uses mtcnn for face analytics

  • (list) (output_types) – Type of output requested by client: “json”, “image”

Return type

A json obj containing the output of object detection

Example:

import dltk_ai
client = dltk_ai.DltkAiClient('YOUR_API_KEY')

image_url = "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c2/2018_BMW_X3_xDrive30d_M_Sport_Automatic_3.0_Front.jpg/515px-2018_BMW_X3_xDrive30d_M_Sport_Automatic_3.0_Front.jpg"

face_analytics_response = client.face_analytics(image_url=image_url, azure=True)

print(face_analytics_response)

Image Classification¶

Classifies an image according to its visual content.

Usage: Identifying the category of the image, Image organisation, etc,

client.image_classification(image_url=None, image_path=None, top_n=3, tensorflow=True,
azure=False, ibm=False,output_types=["json"]):
Parameters

  • image_url – Image URL

  • image_path – Local Image Path

  • top_n – if True, uses dlib for face analyticsget top n predictions

  • tensorflow – if True, uses tensorflow for image classification

  • azure – if True, returns azure results of image classification on given image

  • ibm – if True, uses mtcnn for face analyticsif True, returns ibm results of image classification on given image

  • (list) (output_types) – Type of output requested by client: “json”, “image”

Return type

Image classification response

Example:

import dltk_ai
client = dltk_ai.DltkAiClient('YOUR_API_KEY')

file_path = "../image_classification_sample.jpg"

# Note: top_n=4 predictions, image classification
image_classification = client.image_classification(image_path=file_path, top_n=4)

print(image_classification)
